data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 10 steps forward. Take 10 steps left. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right and take 4 steps. Turn around and turn right. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Just because you took six steps doesn’t mean you take 10 steps back. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Since the sentence starts with take 7 steps and it goes from 1 step to take 7 steps, it is a contradiction in order to turn left at the 7th step. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A simple and sweet solution would be: Take 10 steps to start, Take 10 steps to end, Take 3 steps to end, Take 3 steps to begin, Take 5 steps to begin, Take 10 steps to start, Take 1-3 steps to start, Turn left 2 times, Take 3 steps to finish, Take 3 steps to finish. Thus, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take the first 7 steps to turn around and back then the first 7 steps to turn right and turn left. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 8 steps to turn around, you will take an additional 2 steps back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 4 steps Forward. Take the next 6 steps forward. Face forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The instructions say to take 9 steps. If you backtrack you take the previous 9 steps. If you take 3 steps back you can take 7 steps again. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 1 step backward the first line has a y, while the second is an z. That tells you to take the 1 step backward first. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Steps 1 to 6 can be backfrog left. You can be facing forward in all directions. The answer is no it is not possible to tell.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If we go left again, we can take 9 steps backward and then 3 steps forward. If we go left again, we can only take 6 steps left and so on, and we are always facing forward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The first step a person does in a given location is the first step that is opon their direction of travel. The first step a person takes in a given location is the first step that is their direction of travel. The 4th step a person takes in a given location is the first step that is their direction of travel. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 4 steps backward. Take 5 steps forward. Take 3 steps right. The instructions always require us to take 3 to get back to where we started. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The starting point is the same as the destination. The number is 4. One requires 4 steps to get from one location to the other location. When one is at the starting location, the number becomes 4. The number of steps required to get to the destination from other location is 8. Therefore, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 3 steps. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 10 steps and turn around, the time is now 9 seconds. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 7 steps back to the starting point. It takes 9 steps back to turn around and turn right. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 2 steps. Take 9 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you take 2 steps you walk 3 points back 3 points then turn around for 2 steps. If you take 9 steps you walk 3 points back 4 points then turn that way around for 4 points then turn that way around for 7 steps. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If the person takes steps in one direction, they are required to return to the beginning point in the opposite direction. So, the answer is No.

This is a simple exercise as there is no one to guide in this scenario. The answer: No.

Take 5 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 2 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can only take 3 steps backwards. There is a 7 second delay elif you take 10 steps backwards. Thus, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you take 7 steps to the right and 7 steps to the left, you can find yourself back to the first point you started. If you take 7 steps to the left and 7 steps to the right, you can return to the third point you started at. Thus, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 9 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You always face forward when you walk. If you are not facing forward, you may not end up on the starting point - you can return to the starting point facing backward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To turn around and take 4 steps, you must step back to your starting point twice. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps left. Take 6 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, you can always get to the starting point. If you face left, you are going to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It takes 5 steps to turn around and one turns back. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Just because we are always facing forward doesn’t mean we have to always face forward in the initial direction. Remember? If we are always facing forward it should be obvious to us that we are moving forward and move forward to a location that is still forward. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 4 steps. Take 1 step. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you take 3 steps backwards, you are 1 step away from the starting point. If you take 10 steps backwards, you are a step farther backwards. If you take 1 step backwards, you are 1 step closer backwards. That means 1 step backwards is a 1 step backwards. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Walking clockwise you go around a corner. Turning around clockwise you go back around the corner. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 10 steps right. Take 7 steps backward. Take 3 steps left. Take 8 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A person facing left would always face right. They take 10 steps right, 6 steps back, and 3 steps left. A person facing right would always face forward, 5 steps outward, and 3 steps forward. A person facing left would always face the right-hand-side of the square. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn around. Turn around. Turn around. Take a step. Take 6 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

A person who always faces forward will always take more steps forward than one who always faces backwards. So, the answer is No.

The starting point is always facing forward. The first person who lands on their placed foot does it. They always try to get off. So, the answer is Yes.

If you start with 6 steps right and go 9 steps left, you start with 6 to 4 right. If you start with 5 steps left and go 9 to 2 left, you start with 5 to 2 left. Taking 5 steps left and go 3 to 8 right would get you back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

In the first step, you face forward. Step 2 always takes you backward, 1 step left. When you take step 2, it puts you 4 steps forward. Step 3 is very similar to Step 1, but reverses it by 1 step forward on the first step. Thus, the answer is No.
